pull.title: script: Add explanatory comment to tc.sh
pull.body:
This is a replacement for #21289 

tc.sh is used to limit bandwidth. I ran it and it is limiting my bandwidth. When I ran it, I got one error. I have not found an explanation anywhere of what the error means, but my best guess is consistent with the result, so I propose the explanatory comment to save others time when they use it and also get the error.

events.message: script: Add explanatory comment to tc.sh

events.body:
<!--4a62be1de6b64f3ed646cdc7932c8cf5-->
🕵️ @practicalswift has been requested to review this pull request as specified in the REVIEWERS file.
@laanwj in #21289 you said "Looks good to me otherwise.", is that still the case here?

yes, i am okay with adding this comment, i am not happy with all the hassle around it though, it makes me reluctant to comment at all if every fixup is going to result in a new PR cycle

i would also ideally prefer putting some more effort in it: prevent that error from happening in the first place, so that no one has to be surprised by it, for example by checking if there are `tc` rules and not sending the command unnecessarily (i don't use the tool myself so consider this a random bs suggestion)

that said, LGTM ACK 3a0446fad470595db09929695ff02debe12bd4cd
